ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English unawar, formed by combining the prefix un- (not) + aware (conscious of).

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Not knowing or noticing something; lacking awareness or consciousness of a particular situation or fact.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 没有察觉的；不知道的；未获悉的；对某事缺乏意识或了解。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He was unaware of the changes to the schedule until he arrived at the empty meeting room.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他直到到达空荡荡的会议室时，才意识到时间表发生了变化。
